crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
To retrieve data stored in a cookie sent to the client through addCookie() (or the class constructor), simply pass the $name of the cookie to getCookie(), and the value will be returned if it is available.
If the CRNRSTN Suite :: has been initialized via initCookieEncryption() to apply an encryption layer to the cookie management process, there are special methods for encryption that must be used. See examples and documentation on the following: addEncryptedCookie(), getEncryptedCookie() and deleteEncryptedCookie().
crnrstn_element.crnrstn_returnedvalue: The value stored in the cookie...as it was conveyed to $_COOKIE by the browser during its most resent request to the server.

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: Data stored in cookies created by calling addEncryptedCookie() can only be retrieved with getEncryptedCookie(). getCookie() will not return useful cookie data where encryption has been used.
It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latests gains in security and processing efficiency.
Currently tested on an Ubuntu Server 16.04 running PHP 7.0.22 and Redhat Linux running PHP 5.5.38.

crnrstn_parameter.crnrstn_paramdefinition:
The name of the cookie.
Please see php.net for additional information.
